quotes.quote: There are no innocent bystanders. What were they doing there in the first place?
The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing.
Silence encourages the tormentor, never the tormented.
A person seldom falls sick but the bystanders are animated with a faint hope that he will die.
Like secondhand smoke, the leakage of emotions can make a bystander an innocent casualty of someone else's toxic state.
There are no bystanders in life. Our humanity makes us each a part of something greater than ourselves.
Art changes posture and posture changes innocent bystanders.
All the bystanders at an event worthy of note adopt various gestures of admiration when contemplating the occurrence.
A man's work is his dilemma: his job is his bondage, but it also gives him a fair share of his identity and keeps him from being a bystander in somebody else's world.
The measure of a civilization is in the courage, not of its soldiers, but of its bystanders.
One of the ill effects of cruelty is that it makes the bystanders cruel.
The torments of martyrdom are probably most keenly felt by the bystanders.
One eye witness is better than ten hear sayers.
The honest and good man ought to be exactly like a man who smells strong, so that the bystander as soon as he comes near him must smell whether he choose or not.
What hurts the victim most is not the cruelty of the oppressor, but the silence of the bystander.
The man who is honest and good ought to be exactly like a man who smells strong, so that the bystander as soon as he comes near him must smell whether he choose or not.
Thou shall not be a victim, thou shall not be a perpetrator, and thou shall never, but never, be a bystander.
